answers.answer: Your thyroid and adrenal numbers are borderline, but acceptable.  With the symptoms, the suspicion for  hypothyroidism is certainly realistic.The ACTH of 6 and cortisol of 6.4 suggests fairly intact pituitary-adrenal communication, but does not exclude a low adrenal state due to pituitary  underactivity.The thirst and urination are concerning for diabetes insipidus.All this is best tested through a general endocrinologist if you don't already have one.

question: i had a piuitary tumor it was 22mm.and my surgeon had to scrape my piuitary to remove the tumor, i have the symptoms of hypothyroid, they include...my hair and skin is dry, im weak, get brain fog, stay tired and fatigued, my hands nd feet stay ice cold, my head constantly hurts to the touch, ive gained 20 pounds since the surgery which was a year and a half ago, im starting to get dizzy, shand shaky. i get numb in my head and arms it tingles feels like somthing is crawling under my skin.i get irritable and nervous easy, and i stay depressed. i got to the bathroom alot and i stay thirsty i dont know if this has anything to do with my symptoms. the only medicine im on is dialantin, for my seizures. i had labwork done at 1:20 pm  the results areacth  6  pg/ml  ref range 6-58tsh   0.53 uiu\ml ref 0.5-4.5t3     86   ng/dl   ref   80-180free t4  0.8  ng\dl   ref  06-1.1cortisol,serum   6.4  ug/ldlh   8.4   miu/mlfsh   7.9   miu/mlprolactin   9.7  ng/ml   ref   3-24i want to know with my piutiary being scraped on because of the tumor if my lab results would be the sameas if it wasnt touched, and if u think i have the hpothyroid? please help me understand whats going on with my body. i look like im 5 months pregnate and i didnt get this way untill after the tumor was removed, and i had a hysterectimy.
title: post piuitary sugery  lab question
